page_analysis.text_content:
Recessed porches on the 1st floor

Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:
• Depth of porch is less than 10' and,
• Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor and,
• Exterior side is substantially open.

Note: It is the city’s policy to consider one-story construction to be construction less than 17’ above finished floor. If the porch space is higher, the area will count again as 2nd story equivalency.

Fig 9 Recessed porches on the 1st floor

A This example complies with all three criteria and does NOT count toward gross floor area

B This example violates two of the three criteria;
• the porch depth is greater than 10’ and
• the porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Therefore it DOES count toward gross floor area and if it is higher than 17’ it will count twice (see note).

visual_elements.description: Two isometric architectural drawings of a house illustrating recessed porches on the 1st floor. The left drawing (labeled A) shows a porch with depth less than 10 feet, porch ceiling below the 2nd floor line, and substantially open exterior side, complying with all criteria and not counting toward gross floor area. The right drawing (labeled B) shows a porch with depth greater than 10 feet and porch ceiling above the 2nd floor line, violating two criteria and counting toward gross floor area. Both drawings have annotations marking '2nd floor line', 'Porch ceiling below 2nd floor' (left), 'Height extends past 2nd floor line' (right), and porch depth measurements ('Depth < 10’' on left, 'Depth > 10’' on right).
visual_elements.location: Bottom half of the page, spanning left and right sides

visual_elements.description: A shaded gray box containing a policy note stating the city’s policy on one-story construction being less than 17 feet above finished floor, and that porch space higher than this counts as 2nd story equivalency.
visual_elements.location: Upper right quadrant of the page

additional_notes: Page number 14 at bottom left corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and figures are clear and legible.
cross_references: See note (policy note in gray box) referenced in text regarding 2nd story equivalency.

qualifiers.text: Recessed porches on the ground floor do NOT count toward gross floor area if ALL the following criteria apply:

conditions.text: Depth of porch is less than 10'
Porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
Porch space is higher than 17’ above finished floor

logical_relationships.expression: Depth of porch is less than 10' AND Porch ceiling is below 2nd floor AND Exterior side is substantially open
Porch depth is greater than 10' OR Porch ceiling is above the 2nd floor
If porch space is higher than 17’ above finished floor THEN it will count again as 2nd story equivalency

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if all three criteria (c1, c2, c3) are met to exclude recessed porch from gross floor area
If any of the criteria c4 or c5 are true, count porch toward gross floor area
If porch height exceeds 17 feet (c6), count porch area again as 2nd story equivalency
